title: Report: Amazon Prime now lets you download TV shows
text:
You don’t need an Internet connection to watch Amazon Prime shows and movies, according to CNN.
Amazon has now enabled “offline viewing,” which is pretty much exactly what it sounds like — you can download shows without paying extra (assuming you’re already an Amazon Prime member).
The Amazon logo is projected onto a screen at a press conference on September 6, 2012 in Santa Monica, California. (Photo by David McNew/Getty Images) According to Amazon, offline viewing, a key differentiator from the always-online Netflix and Hulu, should work today if you live in the U.S., U.K., Germany or Austria.
“We are proud to be the first and only online subscription streaming service that enables offline viewing — on vacation, in a car, at the beach, on a plane, wherever our Prime members want to watch they can, regardless of internet connection,” Michael Paull, Amazon’s vice president of digital video, said in a statement.
This comes on the heels of less exciting news for Prime costumers, as Amazon recently announced the possibility of new restrictions on two-day shipping, according to Gizmodo .
